item.title: 5 Best Villain Songs In Video Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Hades 2 introduces full-on villain songs to the series, with Scylla performing "Coral Crown" and unique mechanics in boss fights.
  • Cuphead's memorable villain King Dice's song, "Die House," captures his slick demeanor through jazzy tunes and controlled vocals.
  • Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance features Senator Armstrong's songs "Collective Consciousness" and "It Has To Be This Way," reflecting his beliefs.

Villain songs are commonly associated with mediums outside video games. They usually tend to appear in musicals, where the performers are, by necessity, trained, talented singers. However, some especially ambitious video games refuse to start and stop at a simple leitmotif. On occasion, villains will be given a song with lyrics that, if not explicitly performed by them (or their VA), will still be written from their POV, communicating aspects of their character.

The logic behind this song is often not fixed. Usually, it will be more for the benefit of the players than any sort of greater narrative. But no matter how it's worked into the game, there's no doubt that the following villain songs are certified bangers.

5 Coral Crown

Hades 2

  • Performed by Scylla
  • Vocals by Erin Yvette

Hades is no stranger to featuring sung pieces in its exquisite, often instrumental, soundtrack. Characters like Orpheus and Eurydice are commonly seen singing, even having separate voice actors from their typical ones who specifically perform their musical segments. However, Hades 2 introduces full-on villain songs to the series.

Scylla, the sea monster, is a rock musician who fronts a band called Scylla and the Sirens. Her bandmates are Jetty on the guitar, and Roxy on drums. Despite being sirens, neither of them have any vocal input, an ironic fact that Melinoë notes in certain interactions. Scylla and the Sirens make up the boss of the game's Oceanus level. In line with their occupation, each boss fight doubles as a concert. Unlike Orpheus and Eurydice, Scylla's voice actress, Erin Yvette, performs the vocals for the songs in addition to the dialogue.

There are multiple songs that can play during a boss fight. One of the best is "Coral Crown," a siren song urging all who hear it to offer themselves up as food to Scylla. The game gives special attention to the extent to which the song plays. If an accompanist is taken out, then their part of the song is no longer performed. Additionally, Scylla's singing is muffled when she hides in her shell. Another noteworthy song from her set is "I Am Gonna Claw (Out Your Eyes And Drown You To Death)," which Melinoë interprets as a diss track aimed towards her.

4 Die House

Cuphead

  • Performed by King Dice
  • Vocals by Alana Bridgewater

Known for its challenging difficulty and classic cartoon motif, Cuphead is one of the most memorable games of the late 2010s. One of its major villains is King Dice, the apparent right-hand of The Devil and the game's secondary antagonist. Despite being a major boss, King Dice's villain song plays not when he is fought, but rather in between levels at the various Die Houses.

In order to continue traversing levels, the player must first enter a Die House, where King Dice will allow them to pass, in exchange for soul contracts from certain bosses, who are apparently also in debt to The Devil. It is in the Die House that the eponymous song plays, reiterating his affiliation with The Devil, his demands for soul contracts, and generally the idea he should not be messed with, which is reiterated by backup vocalists. The jazzy, controlled feeling of Die House does a good job encapsulating the character's slick, charismatic demeanor, especially when paired with the vocals of Alana Bridgewater.

3 Sloprano

Conker's Bad Fur Day

  • Performed by The Great Mighty Poo
  • Vocals by Chris Marlow

Conker's Bad Fur Day is known to revel in its explicit sense of humor. With this in mind, it makes sense that one of the game's most famous bosses is a gigantic sentient piece of fecal matter. While virtually every male character in Conker's Bad Fur Day is voiced by Chris Seavor, who is also the game's director, designer, and co-writer, this memorable boss is the sole exception.

The Great Mighty Poo is instead voiced by Chris Marlow. To make use of Marlow's singing talents, the Poo is given a song which is broken up into verses across his fight with Conker. Starting off somewhat slowly and relaxed, the song builds in intensity, even hitting operatic notes as the Poo threatens to shove Conker "up [his] butt." Despite how short the "Sloprano" level is, it is perhaps the most widely remembered portion of the game, with the song's opening lines being frequently quoted by fans.

2 It Has To Be This Way

Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance

  • Senator Armstrong's Theme
  • Vocals by Jimmy Gnecco

Senator Steven Armstrong is the main antagonist of Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance . He is a senator for Colorado who was also a presidential hopeful for the year 2020. His over-the-top mannerisms, memorable dialogue, and clear satirization of American politics were all contributing factors to his continued popularity as an internet meme. Boss themes from Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance are much closer to video game villain themes than certain other villain songs. They begin as instrumentals, but evolve into songs as the final phase of each fight begins. They are not performed by the voice actors for the respective characters.

Armstrong has two "songs," each of which has vocals by Jimmy Gnecco. The first Armstrong fight features "Collective Consciousness," a nationalist anthem. This reflects Raiden's views of Armstrong more than his actual agenda, as Armstrong has not yet revealed his hand to Raiden. In truth, Armstrong wishes to reorganize America into a country where the correct ideals are determined by survival of the fittest. This is reflected in his second song, "It Has To Be This Way," where violence is viewed as a tragic but necessary fact of life, insofar as it determines the laws followed. The song has no conception of right from wrong, viewing war as a rebirth period from which "new life will be born."

1 Want You Gone

Portal 2

  • Performed by GLaDOS
  • Vocals by Ellen McLain

GLaDOS is one of the most iconic villains in video games, debuting in Portal as a passive-aggressive voice who guides the player through levels in the Aperture Science Laboratories Enrichment Center. She is eventually revealed to be a gigantic AI-powered computer network, who tortures Chell (the main character) for her own amusement under the thin veneer of "science." After being defeated, she performs a song for the credits sequence called "Still Alive." Written by comedic singer-songwriter Jonathan Coulton, the song is a bitter and sarcastic tune, taunting the player and vowing to perform more "science." The vocals of the song are provided by Ellen McLain, the voice of GLaDOS, and a frequent presence in Valve games.

Portal 2 adds a bit more depth to GLaDOS, examining her history, temporarily removing her from power, and even having her team up alongside Chell. The game features a similar song for the credits, "Want You Gone," once again written by Coulton and sung by McLain. It has the same sort of bitter sarcasm found in its counterpart, but with a new wrinkle. Even amidst her insults and professed dislike of Chell, GLaDOS now can't avoid feeling some level of affection for Chell. This is punctuated in the chorus, where she states that instead of wanting her dead as she once did, she now only wants Chell to leave the facility.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Today's Quick Wins Tasks (March 2025)
item.description:
Monopoly GO takes the classic board game to the next level with exciting events, tournaments, and daily challenges called Quick Wins. Quick Wins are simple, everyday tasks that reward you with new emojis, stickers, cash, and even dice rolls. Each day, you'll receive three tasks to complete within 24 hours.

When you complete a Quick Wins task, you earn points that contribute to a weekly progress bar. At the end of each week, you’ll win the grand prize if you’ve completed your Quick Wins every day. This is usually a five-star Purple Sticker Pack, but it can sometimes be a Wild Sticker too. Read on to learn about the Quick Wins you can complete today and get one step closer to unlocking the grand prize.

Updated March 2, 2025, by Usama Ali: Monopoly GO’s Quick Wins are quick and easy challenges that reward you with valuable prizes every day, even if you only have a few minutes to play. Each day, you'll find three simple tasks, ranging from rolling a certain number of times to landing on a specific tile. By making these Quick Wins a daily habit, you can win a steady stream of rewards, including dice rolls, cash, and sticker packs. If you consistently do your Quick Wins every day, you’ll be rewarded with a Purple Sticker Pack at the end of the week, which contains a guaranteed five-star sticker. This guide covers all the Quick Wins happening this week, so that you can plan out your strategy and claim the rewards.

We’ve compiled this week’s Quick Wins tasks to give you a head start and help you prepare for the challenges ahead. Bookmark this guide and check back daily for updates!

Weekly Quick Wins Tasks In Monopoly GO (March 3-March 9)

Quick Wins vary from simple actions like rolling the dice a certain number of times to more complex challenges participating in Shutdowns or Bank Heists a specific number of times. By consistently completing Quick Wins, players can earn valuable rewards and progress through the game more quickly.

Here are all the Quick Wins tasks you can complete in Monopoly GO this week:

3 March, Monday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Upgrade 1 Landmark

Dice

Bank heist 1 time

Cash

Roll Doubles 4 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

4 March, Tuesday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Pass Go 1 Time

Dice

Shut Down 1 time

Cash

Collect 3 Stickers

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

5 March, Wednesday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Roll 5 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

Upgrade 1 Landmark

Cash

Land on Chance 2 Times

Dice

6 March, Thursday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Roll 5 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

Bank heist 1 time

Cash

Upgrade 1 Landmarks

Dice

7 March, Friday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Pass Go 2 times

Dice

Shut Down 2 times

Cash

Collect 3 Stickers

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

8 March, Saturday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Collect Cash

Dice

Pass GO 2 Times

Cash

Roll Doubles 2 Times

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

9 March, Sunday:

Quick Wins Task

Rewards

Pass GO 1 Time

1-Star Green Sticker Pack

Complete 1 Bank Heist

Cash

Collect 1 Sticker

Dice

You can roll with a higher multiplier to quickly complete your Quick Wins. For instance, if you need to roll the dice five times, using the x5 multiplier can help you complete this task in one go. This applies to all Quick Win tasks, except building and upgrading landmarks.

After completing a task, hit the “Tap to Claim!” button to add points to your progress bar at the bottom of the screen. As you progress through the Quick Wins during the week, you can win several rewards by hitting the milestones marked on the progress bar.

This weekly progress bar resets every Monday , so make sure to complete your Quick Wins every day to fill the bar and claim the grand prize. The daily Quick Wins reset happens at 1 PM UTC , so complete them on time to avoid losing progress.

When a Partners Event, Tycoon Racers, Peg-E Prize Drop, or Treasure Hunt minigame is live, completing Quick Wins also rewards you with the necessary tokens for these events. This is an effective way to get more tokens every day and conquer these exciting minigames.

item.title: Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree - 8 Weapon Additions That Redefined Combat
item.description:
Summary

  • New weapon types in Elden Ring DLC provide fresh combat options.
  • The weapon archetypes introduced challenge old strategies and expand player choices.
  • Unique weapons like Beast Claws and Perfume Bottles redefine close combat and elemental warfare.

Elden Ring ’s Shadow of the Erdtree DLC introduces new weapon types that change how players can approach the game. New attack forms and unique abilities expand options for both aggressive and tactical playstyles, and help refresh the game’s current arsenal.

Each addition seamlessly blends into the game’s combat while offering some change to current armaments and entirely new ones. These new weapon archetypes both challenge old strategies and expand upon them, redefining combat in interesting ways.

1 Dragon-Hunter’s Great Katana

The Colossal Dragon Slayer

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength and Dexterity

The Dragon-Hunter’s Great Katana is a colossal katana imbued with great power designed for slaying dragons. This sword has a unique skill that is similar to the Moonveil katana, but this one performs a high leaping slash. Charging the attack fires a red aura at a distance, perfect for clearing enemies afar and closing range on dragons.

While this weapon can be effective in PvP combat when used right, or against a small crowd of enemies, its effectiveness lies in slaying dragons with its 20% bonus damage toward both Dragons and Ancient Dragons. Meaning this DLC weapon can help anyone struggling against previous dragon encounters, and most certainly tackle Jagged Peak.

2 Rellana’s Twin Blades

Blades Of The Twin Moon

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, and Faith

Normally a magical weapon has one element of magical power, unless they're modified with magic or consumables. Rellana’s Twin Blades offers a new spin on dual wielding blades and fuses two magic sources in one, glintstone and fire.

This light greatsword scales with Strength, Dexterity, Intellect, and Faith, and has a Moon-and-Fire Stance that cannot be changed out or buffed. This is a paired weapon that allows players to dual wield it. While assuming stance, players can use a normal attack to cast glintstone light waves, and strong attack to perform a spinning attack that bathes the area in a circle flame.

3 Thrusting Shields

Turning Defense Into Offense

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength and Dexterity

The Dueling Shield and Carian Thrusting Shield change combat dynamics by being able to attack and defend at the same time. These shields allow for precise thrusts that eventually break poise and stagger foes. The ability to block while winding up for a heavy attack makes fighting aggressive bosses a breeze.

Both shields come with the Shield Strike Ash of War, but can infuse any other Ash of War instead. A creative use of the thrusting shield is infusing Cold to allow the heavy attack to cause a lot of Frost buildup, allowing players to effectively chisel away their foes.

4 Backhand Blades

Dual Wielding With Style

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength and Dexterity

Backhand Blades offer new nimble ways to dispatch enemies. They can be dual wielded without needing a duplicate, and provide new ways to dance around. New Ashes of War are found in these, like Swift Slash which lets the player dash forward with a flurry of slices, and Blind Spot that dashes at an angle and is useful for dodging around attacks.

Other Backhand Blades like the Smithscript Cirque and Curseblade’s Cirque offer another wild twist. The Smithscript Cirque can be thrown in several curving trajectories, and Curseblade’s Cirque has the unique skill Deadly Dance, which launches the player up and forward in a flurry of spinning slices and follows up with a sharp axe-kick.

5 Beast Claws

The Wild Leaping Slasher

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength and Dexterity

What sets the Beast Claw and Red Bear’s Claw apart from the base game claws is their unique skills, which provide insane combinations of attacks and movement. The Beast Claws have Savage Claws, which viciously slash into the foe repeatedly up to a total of 6 slashes. The Red Bear Hunt skill from Red Bear’s Claw slaughters prey with a series of slashes that create a vacuum of continuous damage.

These claws redefine this weapon type in Shadow of the Erdtree by providing these aggressive close range skills. Beast Claws excel at closing gaps and maintaining pressure with fast-paced, high-risk, high-reward gameplay. Their high weapon status building can be utilized effectively by modifying the damage type with different Ashes of Wars, so this offers a lot of customizability in status affect approach.

6 Smithscript Weapons

Keeping Pressure At A Distance

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, and Faith

Throwing Weapons turn the tables by offering a permanent way to throw weapons at enemies, almost overriding the necessity of throwable items. Smithscript weapons return to the wielder’s hand automatically after throwing, so any pure melee builds can have a good chance at keeping pressure at a distance.

The Smithscript Spear proves fearsome when riding on the back of Torrent, as its range goes farther than other Smithscript weapons. When the Smithscript Shield is thrown, it lingers in the air and hurls toward a target, effectively acting like a homing disc. Even the Smithscript Greathammer can be thrown, annihilating everything in a straight line.

7 Perfume Bottles

Firespark & Chilling Alchemical Warfare

  • Weapon Scaling: Dexterity

Not to be confused with the key item of the same name, Perfume Bottles are now a weapon type that deal clouds of elemental damage. The Ash of War Rolling Sparks shoots a trail of perfumed powder that explodes several hitboxes, and Wall of Sparks Ash of War scatters perfume in a circle with an intense AoE explosion by the end of it.

This style of magic is unique as these elemental clouds can be devastating to a crowd of enemies, and be overwhelming in PvP. The best perfume bottles to utilize in most scenarios are the Firespark Perfume Bottle or Chilling Perfume Bottle, with the Rolling Sparks Ash of War.

8 Dryleaf Arts

Master of Martial Arts

  • Weapon Scaling: Strength and Dexterity

The Dryleaf Arts by far is the most unique weapon addition to Elden Ring . Since there are many ways to buff characters with Talismans and Magic, Dryleaf Arts can become quite overpowered. Especially in combination with the Palm Blast Ash of War it comes with.

Palm Blast imbues the palm with energy to strike with a devastating blast—charging the attack provides an insane amount of poise which means it's virtually impossible to get knocked out of the attack. Due to how quick and wide the normal attacks are paired with unbreakable poise, the Dryleaf Arts allows players to effectively tackle up close battles with no worries at all.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for March 3, 2025
item.description:
Strands is a challenging, daily word puzzle game from the New York Times Games. It blends logic with vocabulary, making it a surprisingly hard word search. Some puzzles feature particularly tricky themed, ramping up the difficulty beyond what even seasoned players might be able to tackle solo.

If today’s puzzle has you stuck, you’re not alone, and a little help might be just what you need. This guide is here to assist, offering spoilers, hints, and even the full answer to get you through. As long as you know the basics of how to play Strands , you’ll find everything you need to solve today’s puzzle with ease.

The NYT Games Strands A Fungus Among-Us #365 March 3, 2025

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue A Fungus Among-Us . It has seven things to find: the Spangram and six themed words.

NYT Strands Spangram Tips and Theme Hints

Searching for some hints that won't give away the whole puzzle? You can find a whole bunch of help in the sections below for this mobile-friendly puzzle game.

General Spangram Hint 2

General Spangram Hint 3

Spoilers for Today's New York Times Strands

If you want to see a spoiler or two, but you don't want to save up non-themed words to get one in-game, you can find two spoilers in the sections below. Each section contains just one spoiled word and a screenshot of where to put it.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to the NYT A Fungus Among-Us Strands

The full answer to the New York Times Games Strands puzzle for March 3rd is located in the expandable section below. Open it up to see all the themed words and where they go inside this challenging puzzle game.

Today's Strands Explained

If you want to know all the details of how this puzzle works, look into the section below. Inside will be a breakdown of what the clue, the Spangram, and the themed words all have in common in this mobile puzzle game like Wordle .

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #631 March 3, 2025
item.description:
Connections is a clever word game that challenges players to group seemingly unrelated words into categories. It’s a mix of logic, vocabulary, and a touch of creativity, making it both engaging and occasionally tricky. And sometimes the puzzle has a difficult selection of words, raising the difficulty level beyond what some fans can do on their own.

If you are stumped by today's puzzle, you might be looking for a hand. This article has everything you need to know to win today's puzzle as long as you are already familiar with how to play Connections . In this, you will find things like spoilers, clues, and even the full answer.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #631 for March 3, 2025

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Leaf, Loaf, Roll, Bone, Scroll, Bar, Dinosaur, Lounge, Club, Bolt, Coin, Reel, Chill, Nugget, Rubble, and Rest.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

The sections below contain a whole bunch of different kinds of clues for this puzzle game. Each one had a different helpful hint, spoiler, or category help.
